yes but when the bios calls it, cd and usb-devices work different, thus the need of hybrid-iso to get both working

means" no more options/parameter for this process known"
so only the processname is shown in []
so that means if i start "df" it would be shown as [/bin/df] and if i use "df -h" it would be shown as "/bin/df -f"
no, afaik those processes mainly are kernel-/system-procs where the kernel has no info how it was called exactly. user-procs like "df" are known with path and all
